channel.title: Count the black dots
channel.description:
1)Count the black dots [URL=http://www.imagesaving.com/Withdraw.aspx?fn=034252073246125.gif][IMG]http://www.imagesaving.com/view.axd?fn=034252073246125.gif[/img][/URL]
2)Stare at the black dot in the middle and whatch the colored spots dissapear [URL=http://www.imagesaving.com/Withdraw.aspx?fn=187209140198059.bmp][IMG]http://www.imagesaving.com/view.axd?fn=187209140198059.bmp[/img][/URL]
3)This one is a video but i really liked it.just follow the instructions explained in the video.after you've done it everything you look at will be really funny [url=http://www.spikedhumor.com/player/FullScreen.aspx?file=http://media.spikedhumor.com/36999/TRIPI.flv&item=1&timestamp=0]http://www.spikedhumor.com/player/FullScreen.aspx?file=http://media.spikedhumor.com/36999[/url]
4)Some Illusion pictures (credits to therealjdb for telling the website) [url=http://mightyillusions.blogspot.com/2006/05/dynamic-luminance-gradient-effect.html]http://mightyillusions.blogspot.com/2006/05/dynamic-luminance-gradient-effect.html[/url]
5)Look at the 2 Persons then stand up and walk backwards while you look at the picture
[URL=http://www.imagesaving.com/Withdraw.aspx?fn=215074141057221.jpg][IMG]http://www.imagesaving.com/view.axd?fn=215074141057221.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Count the black dots
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

“Alan Stubbs from University of Maine in USA made this wonderfull optical illusion. This illusion participated in “Best Visual Illusion Of The Year Contest”, and made it to the finals - The Top 10 Finalists to be exact. What you should do is simple, Alan explained: “For the primary effect, one should sit at a comfortable distance and then move forward toward the center of the figure. An interesting change in apparent brightness and to some degree form will result—what may be called a “here comes the sun” effect. By moving back and forth, this apparent change will repeat”. I really liked this effect, so be sure to check for more versions of this image here. I posted few more inside this post…”

From Here[br][size=1]Posted at: October 12, 2006, 03:57:08 PM[/size][hr]Oh and I like this one:

“Another popular one - and quite unnerving if you’ve never seen it before… Close your left and eye and just focus your right eye on the tiny cross. At some point the big circle will disappear as it crosses your ‘blind spot’. If you can’t see this effect, then try sitting closer/further from the screen.”

Nevermind too small just goto the link below

From Here

Read full topic
